content: Yes, Tito had numerous exhibitions and shows throughout his career. In 1950, he had his first solo exhibition at the Spiral Gallery in New York City. He went on to participate in group exhibitions at prestigious institutions such as the Museum of Modern Art (MoMA) and the Whitney Museum of American Art. In 1968, he had a solo exhibition at the Museum of Modern Art, becoming the first Puerto Rican to have a solo exhibition at the museum. His work has been exhibited in galleries and museums around the world, including in the United States, Europe, and Latin America. Even today, Tito's artwork continues to be showcased in exhibitions and museums, cementing his legacy as a groundbreaking artist.
